page.title: 11Langley Priory Part 2
page.content: The Royal Charter written by Henry VIII has a seal on the bottom depicting Henry VIII on both sides. One side shows Henry on his horse. The Priory has seven bedrooms, a dining room, a sitting room, a tapestry room and a drawing room, plus a large kitchen. Mrs Wagstaff is hoping to find the remains of old graves where the nuns were buried somewhere in the grounds. The Wagstaffs own 130 acres of land where they keep cows, sheep and crops. The Priory has three lakes. In one of them lies the body of Margaret Cheslyn who drowned. The commonest trees around the grounds are Beech, Chesnut and Cedars and the owners have seen a badger, foxes, Stoats and Weasels.
